Direct (Scope 1) GHG emissions
column13: Steadfast aims to reduce the intensity of our operating emissions (scope 1 & 2), with a target for our Australian-controlled businesses to be carbon neutral by 2030.
column20: Emissions Target, Intensity Reduction, Carbon Neutral

column6: Energy indirect (Scope 2) GHG emissions
column13: Steadfast recognises that travel, especially air travel, directly impacts the environment. We reduce the need for unnecessary business travel and encourage the use of more sustainable forms of transport across our operations. Our green travel policy seeks to embed some of the COVID adjustments we have made to how we do business, including virtual meetings, and reduce our environmental impact, including reducing emissions associated with work-related travel.

column6: Other indirect (Scope 3) GHG emissions
column7: Steadfast has also undertaken an analysis of major sources of Scope 3 emissions. While these emissions are outside SteadfastÃ¢ÂÂs operational control, this analysis will provide a strong foundation for Steadfast to target any future value chain emissions reduction initiatives.

column6: GHG emissions intensity
column13: Our primary focus is reducing the intensity of our operating emissions (scope 1 & 2), with the balance offset by carbon credits. Given Steadfast's scope, 1 & 2 emissions arise predominately from petrol consumption and electricity use; our strategy to reach carbon neutral by 2030 includes implementing two abatement options: Green power procurement and Transitioning to electric vehicles.
column20: Carbon Neutral Roadmap, Emissions Reduction, Operating Emissions

column6: Reduction of GHG emissions
column7: Our total carbon emissions footprint increased as Steadfast continued to make Trapped Capital acquisitions, our people returned to the office after COVID lockdowns, and our Network broker's fleet use increased with more in-person client meetings.

Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
Management of significant waste-related impacts
column13: Steadfast recycled 494kg of mixed electronic waste this financial year in our Bathurst Street office. The e-waste recycling service accepts a wide variety of e-waste, such as desktops, laptops, servers, mobile phones, monitors, printers, handheld devices, switches, TVs, modems, speakers, batteries, USB devices, and IT accessories.

New employee hires and employee turnover
column7: Our voluntary staff turnover rate was 12.5%, a decrease from 20.7% in FY22 and 3.5% below the insurance industry FY23 benchmark. Our average current employee tenure is four years and eight months with Steadfast.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column7: Steadfast has a short-term employee incentive plan to increase market competitiveness and attract, retain and motivate our people. The scheme has been designed to ensure goal alignment throughout the business, allowing our people to receive shares in Steadfast. Along with salary and incentive arrangements, Steadfast offers a wide-ranging benefits program for our people, including travel insurance and discounts on a wide range of consumer goods and cars.

column6: Parental leave
column7: We offer paid parental leave at 12 weeksÃ¢ÂÂ full pay. If our people wish, we engage with them while they are on parental leave to maintain a sense of connectedness and ease the transition back to work. Steadfast provides a parentsÃ¢ÂÂ room in our head office as practical support for the increasing number of new parents in our team and to ease their transition back to work.

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column7: Our Board receives regular work, health and safety (WHS) reports. We have a committee to provide a forum for our people to suggest initiatives and raise any concerns. In May 2023, Safety Australia Group audited our Workplace Health and Safety management systems and arrangements to find Steadfast compliant.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Our risk management process identifies, assesses, evaluates and manages the key business risks. We also have a risk appetite statement, which sets out the type and magnitude of risk the Board is willing to accept to achieve the organisation's objectives. A risk appetite scorecard that tracks performance against the risk appetite statement is presented quarterly to the Audit and Risk Committee.
column20: Risk management, Risk appetite, Risk scorecard

column6: Occupational health services
column7: Steadfast provides a comprehensive health and well-being program. Some of our initiatives include Annual health assessments and flu shots, Insurance and protection benefits, an annual financial well-being health check, and Access to confidential external Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs) for counselling to support mental health.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column7: Steadfast provides a range of education and awareness of key health and wellbeing issues, including physical fitness, nutrition, mental health and stress management.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column7: Steadfast provides training Ã¢ÂÂ 5% of staff have been trained as mental health first aid officers.

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column7: All of our people completed at least one training program in FY23

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: We implemented a new Leave Swap Policy this year to support our diversity. This policy allows employees to swap up to three state or federal public holidays each year for another important day.\t

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: Steadfast offers an Additional Leave Purchase Scheme, enabling our people to sacrifice salary to acquire additional annual leave, facilitating a better balance between professional and personal lives.

Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Steadfast's College of Leadership offers our current and future leaders the opportunity to develop by exposing them to forward-thinking, relevant and practical leadership methodology and application. In addition to leadership and management training, our people participate in annual development planning to ensure their continued technical and non-technical development. During the year, 19 Steadfast employees were internally promoted, of whom nine were female.
column20: Leadership development, Employee programs, Development Planning

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: At Steadfast, we recognise the importance of developing young talent. This year, Steadfast's Graduate Development Program was recognised at The GradAustralia Top 100 Graduate Employers Awards as the Best in Industry (Banking & Financial Services Sector) for Diversity & Inclusiveness. Further demonstrating its success, Steadfast has retained 13 of the 16 graduates participating in our program.
column20: Graduate Development Program, Young Talent, Diversity
